thread.title: Bengals practice report: 3 starters don't go; 3 others limited
thread.title_full: Bengals practice report: 3 starters don't go; 3 others limited

title: Bengals practice report: 3 starters don't go; 3 others limited
text:
Bengals practice report: 3 starters don't go; 3 others limited 
Updated: Wed, Sep 30 2015, 06:56 PM 
CINCINNATI (Richard Skinner) -- While the Bengals had three starters who didn't participate in Wednesday's practice and three others who were limited participants it will be surprising if every one of them doesn't play on Sunday. 
The Bengals began on-field preparations on Wednesday for Sunday's game against the Kansas City Chiefs in Paul Brown Stadium. 
The three starters who didn't participate on Wednesday were: cornerback Adam Jones, offensive tackle Andrew Whitworth and safety George Iloka. 
Jones suffered an elbow injury in Sunday's 28-24 win at Baltimore when he was tackled returning the opening kickoff of the second half. Jones appeared to be in significant pain both as he was treated on the field and while on the sidelines as the offense was on the field, but returned for the first defensive snap of the second half and played the rest of the game. 
Whitworth's absence on Wednesday was listed as non-injury related, which means he was given a veteran's day off. He has been given that at least one day per week this season and did almost every week last season. 
Iloka took himself out of Sunday's game with an ankle injury and was replaced by Shawn Williams. Iloka played 43 defensive snaps in the game and Williams played 31. 
Jones, Whitworth and Iloka were all seen during the 30 minutes practice is open to the media taking part in warm-up and stretching. Jones and Iloka are probably just being given an extra day to allow their injuries to heal. 
The three players who were limited participants on Wednesday were cornerback Leon Hall (non-injury related, which means likely a veteran's day off); cornerback Dre Kirkpatrick (shoulder) and tackle Andre Smith (hip). 
Kirkpatrick got hurt trying to tackle Steve Smith as he crossed the goal line in the third quarter of Sunday's game in Baltimore, but remained in the game and played all 74 defensive snaps. 
Smith missed some practice time last week due to a buttocks injury, but played in Sunday's game. 
Defensive tackle Pat Sims was a full practice participant after missing Sunday's game due to a hip injury and defensive lineman Marcus Hardison also was a full participant. Hardison missed the first three games of the season due in part to a knee injury. 
George Iloka Photo: Local 12 staff photo
